intro: Stelis cupreata, commonly known as the coppery stelis, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking copper-colored flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are often fragrant and attract various pollinators.
